alert.note: Alert for Osceola (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 11 at 12:11PM EDT by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Osceola County through 145 PM EDT... At 1211 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles south of Mitchell State Park, or 10 miles south of Cadillac, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Marion... Highland... Le Roy... Tustin... Avondale... Dighton... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
